title: Saint William's Cathedral (Diocese of Laoag)
description: A 1612 church features Italian Renaissance styling, a stately facade & an adjacent bell tower.

title: San Agustin Church of Paoay
description: Famous for its Baroque-style architecture, this 1710, catholic church offers regular mass services.

title: La Virgen Milagrosa
description: A severed wooden statue of the Virgin Mary, believed to have miraculously washed ashore in Ilocos Norte.

title: Blue Lagoon
description: Tropical, waterfront area with a sandy beach, offering swimming, surfing, sunbathing & picnic space.

title: Saud Beach
description: Uncrowded tropical beach with gentle waves in shallow water & overlooked by a few resort hotels.

title: Badoc Island White Beach
description: A secluded island beach featuring white sand and clear waters, located off the coast of Badoc.

title: Museo Ilocos Norte
description: A cultural museum preserving Ilocano heritage through traditional clothing, artifacts, and historical exhibits.

title: Malaca√±ang of the North
description: A former presidential residence turned museum, showcasing the Marcos family's history and lifestyle.

title: Juan Luna Shrine (Badoc)
description: Ancestral home and museum honoring Juan Luna, featuring replicas of his works and memorabilia.

title: Batac Riverside Empanadaan
description: Home of Batac's famous Empanadas.

title: Cuisine de Iloco Restaurant
description: One of Ilocos Norte's must-try restaurants serving a plethora of Ilocano Cuisines.

title: Eagle's Nest Bar and Restaurant
description: A restaurant with an extensive menu featuring Filipino cuisine including native Ilocano dishes.

title: Kapurpurawan Rock Formation
description: Noteworthy geological formation by the beach, accessible by hiking or horseback riding.

title: Tanap-Avis Falls
description: The basin-like waterfalls is a popular destination because of its pigmented turquoise waters.

title: Bantay Abot Cave
description: Short tunnel through a headland covered in vegetation, overlooking a rocky beach with strong waves.

title: Bangui Windmills
description: Oceanfront wind farm & tourist attraction featuring 20 turbines facing the sea.

title: Cape Bojeador Lighthouse
description: Philippine-Spanish lighthouse atop a hill, built in 1892.

title: Patapat Viaduct
description: Elevated concrete bridge featuring picturesque mountain & sea views.

title: Paoay Sand Dunes
description: A historical natural landscape used during World War II.

title: Batac Public Market
description: A produce market offering traditional Ilocano goods.

title: Laoag City Commercial Complex
description: A public market where you can find almost everything.

title: Nagbacalan Loomweavers
description: Traditional Ilocano textile and fabric weaving.
